intro: Volutaria abyssinica subsp. aylmeri, commonly known as the Abyssinian volutaria, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
